name: Lyron Co Ting Keh
bio:
My areas of interest include recursion [eg. Zator: verified inference
 of a 512 layer CNN using Nova], threshold schemes [eg. Proactive 
Refresh: cycling key shares for threshold signatures], and low-level 
cryptography [eg. KZG Chip: an optimized multi-open verifier in Halo2]. 
Projects along these lines have led me to my current work on interactive
 shielding @ Seismic. Ack: the aforementioned projects have all been 
carried out under tremendous support from 0xPARC and Dan Boneh.
